title: Lesson 2026-02-11 — Comparisons, Preferences, and Days of the Week

vocabulary.jp: 犬と猫とどちらの方が好きですか？
vocabulary.reading: Inu to neko to dochira no hou ga suki desu ka?
vocabulary.en: Do you prefer dogs or cats? / Which do you like more, dogs or cats?

vocabulary.jp: 本と映画とどちらの方が好きですか？
vocabulary.reading: Hon to eiga to dochira no hou ga suki desu ka?
vocabulary.en: Do you prefer books or movies?

vocabulary.jp: 寒いと暑いとどちらの方が嫌いですか？
vocabulary.reading: Samui to atsui to dochira no hou ga kirai desu ka?
vocabulary.en: Which do you hate more, cold or hot?

vocabulary.jp: 猫の方が犬より好きです
vocabulary.reading: Neko no hou ga inu yori suki desu
vocabulary.en: I prefer cats more than dogs

vocabulary.jp: 冬より夏の方が好きです
vocabulary.reading: Fuyu yori natsu no hou ga suki desu
vocabulary.en: I prefer summer more than winter

vocabulary.jp: 本より映画の方が好きです
vocabulary.reading: Hon yori eiga no hou ga suki desu
vocabulary.en: I prefer movies more than books

vocabulary.reading: Natsu mo fuyu mo suki desu
vocabulary.en: I like both summer and winter

vocabulary.reading: Natsu mo fuyu mo kirai desu
vocabulary.en: I hate both summer and winter

vocabulary.jp: ラーメンが好きですから

vocabulary.en: I don't have a particular reason
I just like it (no particular reason)

vocabulary.jp: 赤いと青いとどちらの方がいいですか？
vocabulary.reading: Akai to aoi to dochira no hou ga ii desu ka?
vocabulary.en: Which is better, red or blue?

vocabulary.jp: 長いと短いとどちらの方がいいですか？
vocabulary.reading: Nagai to mijikai to dochira no hou ga ii desu ka?
vocabulary.en: Which is better, long or short?

vocabulary.jp: 白いと黒いとどちらの方がいいですか？
vocabulary.reading: Shiroi to kuroi to dochira no hou ga ii desu ka?
vocabulary.en: Which is better, white or black?

grammar.pattern: Making Comparisons — どちらの方が
grammar.explanation:
Structure:

A と B と どちらの方が [adjective] ですか


Pattern breakdown:
- と — particle connecting the two options
- どちら — which one (formal/polite version of どれ)
- の方が — the directi

examples.en: と — particle connecting the two options

examples.jp: どちら — which one (formal/polite version of どれ)
examples.en: の方が — the direction/side of (indicates preference/comparison)

grammar.explanation:
Structure:

[Preferred option] の方が [Less preferred option] より [adjective] です


Pattern breakdown:
- の方が — indicates the preferred/more significant option
- より — than (marks the

examples.en: の方が — indicates the preferred/more significant option

examples.jp: より — than (marks the comparison baseline)

grammar.explanation:
Both (positive):

A も B も [adjective] です


| Japanese | Romaji | English |
|----------|--------|---------|
| 夏も冬も好きです | Natsu mo fuyu mo suki desu | I like both summer and winter |
| どちらも好き

Structure:

[Reason] から


Examples:

| Japanese | Romaji | English |
|----------|--------|---------|
| ラーメンが好きですから | Ramen ga suki desu kara | Because I like ramen |
| 暑いですから | Atsui de

grammar.pattern: "Which is better/easier?" — どちらの方がいいですか
grammar.explanation:
Structure:

A と B と どちらの方がいいですか？


Examples:

| Japanese | Romaji | English |
|----------|--------|---------|
| 赤いと青いとどちらの方がいいですか？ | Akai to aoi to dochira no hou ga ii desu ka? | Which

practice_phrases: A と B と どちらの方が [adjective] ですか
[Preferred option] の方が [Less preferred option] より [adjective] です
[Less preferred] より [Preferred] の方が [adjective] です
A も B も [adjective] です
A も B も [negative adjective] です
A と B と どちらの方がいいですか？
summary:
Date: February 11, 2026 (Lesson #13)  
Duration: ~55 minutes  
Topic: Making comparisons, expressing preferences, days of the week kanji
